newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hanbo loans blamed on lack of credit analysis.
newsitem.headline: Hanbo loans blamed on lack of credit analysis.

text.p: South Korea's Office of Bank Supervision (OBS) said on Thursday domestic banks extended huge loans to the faltering Hanbo Steel Co without any proper credit analysis.
Five banks granted a total of 3.13 trillion won ($3.64 billion) in credits to Hanbo without adequate feasibility studies, the bank watchdog said in an interim briefing.
The OBS launched in January a special probe into the loans made by Korea First Bank, Cho Hung Bank, Korea Exchange Bank, SEOULBANK and the state-run Korea Development Bank.
An OBS statement said Korea Development Bank and Cho Hung Bank lent 911.5 billion won on a 1.4 trillion mortgage, and 496 billion with 539.8 billion collateral, respectively.

But Korea First Bank extended a total of 1.1 trillion won in loans with only a 926.5 billion mortgage; Korea Exchange Bank gave out 429.8 billion won on 405.4 billion in collateral; and SEOULBANK, 210 billion won on a 173.5 billion mortgage.

The office also pointed to a lack of professional ratings companies in South Korea. "Due to a sparcity of professional domestic ratings companies, financial institutions tend to analyse big projects by themselves," it said.
"The loans also have been given for the convenience of borrowers," OBS said.
Hanbo Steel, the flagship of the nation's 14th largest Hanbo Group, was declared insolvent on January 23 after piling up five trillion in loans.
Opposition parties called the loans the biggest financial scandal in the nation's history and have accused the government of peddling influence to pressure banks into offering loans.
State prosecutors indicted 10 people over the scandal on Wednesday, including three close aides to President Kim Young-sam.
Three bankers are among those indicted, including two former presidents of Korea First Bank.
The watchdog body said it would turn over the results of probe to the banks by February 25, leaving action up to them. ($ = 859.30 won)
